result.execSummary:
The defendant Russ Allen Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate State/County Institution Laws, a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.73.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted a payment plan of $100.00 per month to begin  05/15/2017 along with case 12CT116.

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
